content: see the stitches and don t need the markers 1st section use approx ¼ of your yarn round 1 1 *k9 p5 repeat from * 14 sts in each repeat repeat this row until you are ready to decrease 1st decrease round *k9 p2tog p3 repeat from * work once then continue with section 2 section 2 use approx ¼ of your yarn round 2 1 *k9 p4 repeat from * 13 sts in each repeat 2nd decrease round *k9 p2tog p2 repeat from * then continue with section 3 section 3 use approx ¼ of your yarn round 3 1 *k9 p3 repeat from * 12 sts in each repeat 3nd decrease round *k9 p2tog p1 repeat from * then continue with section 4 section 4 use approx ¼ of your yarn round 4 1 *k9 p2 repeat from * 11 sts in each repeat optional extra decrease round - if you wish to work another decrease round work it as follows when you have about 1/8th of your yarn left *ssk k7 p2 repeat from * then work section 5 as k8 p2 10 sts in each repeat continue until you have just enough yarn left to bind off bind off in pattern knitting the knits and purling the purls or by working in the back loops link http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/relaxing-relatively-stretchy-bind-off html block lightly if needed © ashcroft-hempsall 2015 - for personal non-commercial use only
